props.calculateWidths: Enables calculation of column widths. `widths` property will be available in select scoped slots
props.caption: Set the caption (using `<caption>`)
props.expandIcon: Icon used for expand toggle button.
props.fixedHeader: Fixed header to top of table. **NOTE:** Does not work in IE11
props.groupBy: Changes which item property should be used for grouping items. Currently only supports a single grouping in the format: `group` or `['group']`. When using an array, only the first element is considered. Can be used with `.sync` modifier
props.groupDesc: Changes which direction grouping is done. Can be used with `.sync` modifier
props.headerProps: Pass props to the default header. See 'v-data-table-header' API for more information
props.headers: An array of objects that each describe a header column. See the example below for a definition of all properties
props.headersLength: Can be used in combination with `hide-default-header` to specify the number of columns in the table to allow expansion rows and loading bar to function properly
props.height: Set an explicit height of table
props.itemClass: Property on supplied `items` that contains item's row class or function that takes an item as an argument and returns the class of corresponding row
props.items: The array of items to display
props.itemsPerPage: Changes how many items per page should be visible. Can be used with `.sync` modifier
props.locale: Sets the locale used for sorting. This is passed into [`Intl.Collator()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Intl/Collator/Collator) in the default `customSort` function
props.mobileBreakpoint: Used to set when to toggle between regular table and mobile view
props.multiSort: If `true` then one can sort on multiple properties
props.mustSort: If `true` then one can not disable sorting, it will always switch between ascending and descending
props.search: Text input used to filter items
props.serverItemsLength: Used only when data is provided by a server. Should be set to the total amount of items available on server so that pagination works correctly
props.showSelect: Shows the select checkboxes in both the header and rows (if using default rows)
props.showExpand: Shows the expand toggle in default rows
props.showGroupBy: Shows the group by toggle in the header and enables grouped rows
props.sortBy: Changes which item property (or properties) should be used for sort order. Can be used with `.sync` modifier
props.sortDesc: Changes which direction sorting is done. Can be used with `.sync` modifier
props.virtualRows: Virtualizes the rendering of rows. Be aware that you can not use the `body`, `body.prepend` or `body.append` slots with this prop.

slots.body: Slot to replace the default table `<tbody>`
slots.body.append: Appends elements to the end of the default table `<tbody>`
slots.body.prepend: Prepends elements to the start of the default table `<tbody>`
slots.footer: Slot to add a custom footer
slots.footer.page-text: Slot to customize footer page text
slots.group: Slot to replace the default rendering of grouped rows
slots.group.header: Slot to customize the default rendering of group headers
slots.group.summary: Slot to customize the default rendering of group summaries
slots.heading: Slot to add a custom header
slots.header.<name>: Slot to customize a specific header column
slots.header.data-table-select: Slot to replace the default `v-simple-checkbox` in header
slots.item: Slot to replace the default rendering of a row
slots.item.data-table-select: Slot to replace the default `v-simple-checkbox` used when selecting rows
slots.item.data-table-expand: Slot to replace the default `v-icon` used when expanding rows
slots.item.<name>: Slot to customize a specific column
slots.loading: Defines content for when `loading` is true and no items are provided
slots.no-data: Defines content for when no items are provided
slots.no-results: Defines content for when `search` is provided but no results are found
slots.progress: Slot to replace the default `<v-progress-linear>` component
slots.top: Slot to add content above the table

events.click:row: Emits when a table row is clicked. This event provides 2 arguments: the first is the item data that was clicked and the second is the other related data provided by the `item` slot. **NOTE:** will not emit when table rows are defined through a slot such as `item` or `body`.
events.contextmenu:row: Emits when a table row is right-clicked. The item for the row is included. **NOTE:** will not emit when table rows are defined through a slot such as `item` or `body`.
events.dblclick:row: Emits when a table row is double-clicked. The item for the row is included. **NOTE:** will not emit when table rows are defined through a slot such as `item` or `body`.
